medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Pain has been present intermittently, post-prandial, in the RUQ and epigastric region. The first episode was attributed to bad clams, but there has been increasing frequency of episodes. The patient experienced nausea, vomiting (NBNB emesis x3), and anorexia. Severe RUQ/epigastric pain awoke the patient from sleep, prompting the visit to the emergency department.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Coronary artery disease (CAD), hyperlipidemia (HLD), hypertension (HTN), history of percutaneous transluminal coronary angioplasty (PTCA) of OM-1, atrial fibrillation, nonsustained supraventricular tachycardia with exercise, rheumatoid arthritis, bronchogenic cyst, anemia, monoclonal gammopathy, splenic infarct, basal cell carcinoma.
medical_history.family_history: No history of coronary artery disease (CAD) or diabetes mellitus (DM).
